title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 43-2.11 - Tolerance of under size surf clams
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 43-2.11 - Tolerance of under size surf clams

State Regulations
(a) Surf clams less than four inches in the
longest diameter may not be taken from certified waters. When unintentionally
and unavoidably taken, surf clams of less than four inches in the longest
diameter may comprise, by number, no more than 20 percent of any
catch. (b) For the purpose of
determining compliance with this section, not less than one representative U.S. standard bushel may be taken from a container or from any lot for examination. If the amount taken for examination is found to contain a number of surf clams
of less than four inches in the longest diameter in excess of 20 percent by
count, the container or lot from which such sample was taken is be deemed to
contain in excess of 20 percent of surf clams of less than four inches in the
longest diameter. (c) If the
procedure specified in subdivision (b) of this section establishes that more
than 10 percent of containers which comprise a vessel's total catch contain in
excess of 20 percent of surf clams of less than four inches in the longest
diameter, all containers comprising such total catch are deemed to contain in
excess of 20 percent of surf clams less than four inches in the longest
diameter. Notes
